posts.post_content: This isn't as bad as people are making out. If you ignore the recent silly overpowered creatures, black getting a 5/5 for 5 is a fine deal. Just use it in a creature light deck. It isn't even like it can't be used with other creatures - you can have already cast them. You can cast them and accept this dies. It's a 2 star card imo.

posts.post_content:
**Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.**  
  
This card references [Skittering Horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skittering Horror), even down to it's flavor text.

Posted By: Missile_Penguin (12/10/2012 12:31:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Actually it is just as bad as people are making it out to be.  
  
[Skittering Horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skittering Horror) was at least somewhat useful because it was aggressively costed, netting you a 4/3 for only 3 mana. I don't know what they were thinking when they designed this card, they took a card with a benefit and a drawback and timeshifted it into a card with all drawback. It could've been a 6/5 trampler for 5 with the sacrifice ability, that would've made it more like its predecessor.
posts.html:
